T H E   M O V I E

Based on the award-winning play by Joshua Sobol, "Ghetto"

COUNTRY: Lithuania
DIRECTOR: Audrius Juzenas
SCREENWRITER: Joshua Sobol
ORIGINAL MUSIC: Anatolijus Senderovas
CAST: Erika Marozsan, Heino Ferch, Sebastian Hulk, Andrius Zebrauskas,
Vytautas Sapranauskas, Margarita Ziemelyte, Adrija Cepaite, Alvydas Slepikas,
Jork Lamprecht...
STUDIO/PRODUCER: Didziuju Motinu Studija, Lithuanian / New Transit Film -
Dragon Cine - V.I.E., Germany / Prior Video

In 1942, in Vilnus, the Nazis annihilate 55,000 Jews and squeeze the 15,000
survivors into a seven block ghetto.  A twenty-two year old sadistic
commander, Kittel, is assigned to administrate the ghetto in the capital of
Lithuania, becoming the master of life or death.  When he finds the gorgeous
Hayyah sneaking with one kilogram of beans stolen from the German army, he
sentences her to death; but when he is informed that she was a former
successful singer, he decides to activate the old theater and promote shows in
the ghetto. The Jewish Chief of Police, Gens, uses the theater and a sewing
factory to save as many lives as he can; in his ambiguous position, he kills
some Jews to save the lives of others.
